      • itemClicked

        public void itemClicked(java.lang.Object object,
                        java.lang.Integer customTag,
                        java.lang.Integer positionIfAvailable)
        Click Listener
        Specified by:
        itemClicked in interface CustomClickCallbackLink
        Parameters:
        object - Object
        customTag - Object(s) being sent back. if you want, you can use if(obj instanceof XX) and use that as a separator.
        positionIfAvailable - int position. This will be sent back as not null when there is a reason to include it. That reason may be that the item selected was chosen from a listview/ Recyclerview, in which case the position can be helpful. If this is not set, it will send back

      • itemLongClicked

        public void itemLongClicked(java.lang.Object object,
                            java.lang.Integer customTag,
                            java.lang.Integer positionIfAvailable)
        Long click listener
        Specified by:
        itemLongClicked in interface CustomLongClickCallbackLink
        Parameters:
        object - Object(s) being sent back. if you want, you can use if(obj instanceof XX) and use that as a separator.
        customTag - The integer custom tag. Use this for sending back specific tags that you want to reference and differentiate between.
        positionIfAvailable - int position. This will be sent back as not null when there is a reason to include it. That reason may be that the item selected was chosen from a listview/ Recyclerview, in which case the position can be helpful. If this is not set, it will send back
